main event: A reddish colored circular object was observed over Rydall, Pennsylvania, on February 13, 1963.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be Mars but was observed as two discs with a narrow gap between them., The object moved very slowly with no sound, estimated at 40-50 feet in diameter., Witnesses noted yellowish orange light around the edge of the object., The sighting lasted for 2-5 minutes before the object accelerated to a high speed and disappeared., Witnesses described it as not behaving like any conventional aircraft they had seen before.
sighted object: reddish circular object or two discs
witness description: The observer described the object as stationary and perplexed by its unusual behavior.
